title.narrative: Promoting Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGBV Survivors

description.narrative: Improved wellbeing, social and economic empowerment and safety of women and girls (15 years and older) who have been affected by conflict in Iraq, focusing on women at risk of and those who have survived sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV)
Internally displaced and returning women, girls, men and boys, their families and communities in conflict-affected Ninewah and Duhok governorates

Partners in the project: Azidie Fraternity and Solidarity League (ASFL) for the first three months only, Emma Organization for Human Development (EMMA) and People’s Development Organization (PDO) and Baghdad Women’s Association (BWA)

Strengthened civil society organisations are actively coordinating, protecting and promoting the rights and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls, Conflict-affected women and girls who are survivors of SGBV receive quality case management, MHPSS services and reintegration support, and Conflict-affected women and girls 15 and over report improved rights awareness, life skills and confidence
Activity is being implemented in Duhok governorate, covering IDPs inside camps and host communities.

activity-description.narrative: Improved wellbeing, social and economic empowerment and safety of women and girls (15 years and older) who have been affected by conflict in Iraq, focusing on women at risk of and those who have survived sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV)

description.narrative: Humanitarian Aid / Protection

title.narrative: 1211- Sensitive outreach & community mobilization for the promotion of project services is carried out with conflict-affected women and girls, men and boys 15+ in 4 operational areas

description.narrative: At the inception of the community centres’ work, activities focused on providing outreach/community mobilization awareness on the project services and available activity opportunities through individual household visits or group sessions in public or private places. The volunteers with all four partners are conducting sensitive outreach for the purpose of promotion of project services using brochures through visiting house to house and through meeting with group of people in school, hospital, cultural centers, visiting other service providers.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of conflict-affected women, men, boys, girls to receive sensitive outreach for the promotion of project services
1000-Improved wellbeing and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls 15 years and older with particular focus to SGBV survivors in Iraq and KRI

description.narrative: Changes in the well-being status of conflict affected women and girls 15+ depend on a set of factors, such as their current health status and whether they experience any relevant psychological disorders, how far they have control over their lives, their perceptions of safety, and prevalence of SGBV in their communities.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Women, girls, men and boys 15+ approve of women and adolescent girls' participation in public life and decision-making.

comment.narrative: The baseline and endline results will be measured by the end of project to report this indicator as impact of the project

title.narrative: Improved well-being of conflict-affected women and girls 15+ who report reduced trauma symptoms (anxiety, desperation, fear etc.) by the end of the project period.

comment.narrative: The difference between baseline and endline values will be measured by end of the project to report this indicator

title.narrative: 1410 NPA partner quickly and efficiently responded to Covid-19 pandemic

description.narrative: Due to COVID-19 pandemic many families and individuals found themselves lacking some basic needs such as food and hygiene, NPA and partners found that it is essential given the situation to provide these urgent needs to IDP especially those who are living outside camps since they don’t receive food rations from other food assistance NGOs. , a new budget line for COVID-19 response was made to cover food assistance and the provision of hygiene kits Partners’ staff made vulnerability assessments for all beneficiaries, identifying in-kind assistance for those in more urgent need.

title.narrative: Online Document
# of individuals received hygiene kits
# of families and individuals received food baskets

description.narrative: for food assistance, NPA and partners targeted families that became vulnerable and lost their livelihoods because of the pandemic.

title.narrative: # of food baskets distributed
1234.1- SGBV survivors set up sustainable micro-enterprises

description.narrative: During the second and third years of the project, three livelihood officers will train women and girls in targeted areas about business skills and business management and then will select those who meet eligibility criteria. The selected women and girls will then suggest their ideas and with the assistance of the livelihood officer will prepare an implementation plan, the partners then will provide needed materials to their micro businesses.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors received micro-enterprise
1212-Confidential case management is provided for interested conflict-affected women and girls 15+ who are residing in 4 operational areas

description.narrative: Maintaining confidentially of SGBV cases was an issue of high importance, which was always strengthened through proper documentation process and filing systems, following sensitive information, disclosure policy and code-of-conduct stipulations. In addition, the media coverage of the project activities was minimized to prevent public disclosure of the involved people. In certain areas or circumstances, gender specific considerations were made to allow free and comfortable participation in gender-specific activities, for example, conducting separate awareness sessions for women/girls or men/boys, as needed. The high level of confidence and trust building between the partner case managers and the SGBV and trauma survivors encouraged the latter to declare their situation and accept the potential social recognition and stigma that may arise from accessing different services.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
% of women and girls 15+ to receive follow-up sessions after intake assessment. % of clients who possess an action plan.
% of clients who possess an action plan

description.narrative: 100% of the survivors have action plan, the action plan is done by taking into consideration the concepts of survivor centered approach and do no harm, also the social workers together with the survivors work on preparing the action plan.

title.narrative: 1233- Business skills and management training and follow-up mentoring sessions are held for SGBV survivors

description.narrative: NPA will hire a local consultant to train the livelihood officers of the three partners, the consultant will design training course tools and presentations for the livelihood officers about business skills and management, the livelihood officers then will train women and girls and provide mentorship to them during the first months of the business start.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors attended business skills and management training sessions

1213- Confidential referrals to specialized service providers (medical, psychiatric, legal, child protection, education & livelihoods, etc.) are provided to conflict-affected women and girls 15+ in 4 operational areas.

description.narrative: Referrals as made with the consent of the survivors and usually before the partners start working in an area they do actor mapping and find services that most likely the survivors will need. in 2020 mostly partners focused on strengthening their coordination with NGOs that provide Covid relief assistance from food and hygiene kits to refer cases who need these services.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
% of clients who received a referral
% referrals followed up by social workers.
1321- Awareness-raising sessions are held on harmful social norms, gender norms and women's rights for women, girls, men and boys 15+ in 4 operational areas.

description.narrative: The awareness raising sessions discuss the topics that are more relevant to the context of the targeted areas and familiarizing communities with women rights and preventing violence against women. During the previous project, partners learnt a lot about the most effective ways to deliver awareness raising sessions and with the baseline survey they planned to deliver the activities that reflect common issues women face in the community and make sure conflict affected women are better able to understand and access their rights to participate: psychosocial, recreational, economic, educational, family and community decision-making processes.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of beneficiaries to attend awareness-raising sessions.

description.narrative: CSO partners delivered activities onlone during the lockdown and once it ended they started delivering activities on ground instead online, women and girls were delighted to see this change especially because not all of them had internet access thus they were quite pleased to participate in activities face to face and discuss topics that matters to them.

title.narrative: Number of awareness raising sessions completed

description.narrative: The awareness-raising sessions in 2020 were mostly about domestic violence, women’s rights, reproductive health, family planning, protection from sexual exploitation, maintaining physical and mental health during COVID-19 lockdown. while lockdown itself didn't last for a very long time however its effects were noticeable till the end of the year, one of the main effect was the increase of domestic violence and early marriage.

title.narrative: % of beneficiaries who report the session was “very useful” in an exit survey
1400 Targeted communities/ beneficiaries took necessary protective measures to contain COVID

description.narrative: at the beginning of the pandemic in 2020 beneficiaries found themselves in need of knowledge and urgent assistance to to take protective measures however due to many sites and social media outlets publishing false information communities felt helpless and unaware of the right measures that is when NPA and partners focused on delivering right messages about COVID-19 pandemic to beneficiaries so that they can protect themselves and their families.

title.narrative: Online Dashboard

description.narrative: since the beginning of the pandemic NPA and partners understood the importance of raising awareness about COVID-19 and encourage communities especially women to take protective measures, many awareness raising sessions and meetings were held to increase the knowledge of beneficiaries about the pandemic.

title.narrative: % of total partners’ beneficiaries receive emergency support
1123- TOT on Orienting Local Activity Leaders/volunteers (e.g. Code of Conduct, GBV Core Concepts, Effective PSS Sessions, and Trauma-Sensitivity) is held for staff from 3 CSO partners.

description.narrative: during 2020 NPA was able to train partners focusing on the new partner BWA, however time did not allow us to train the volunteers instead the trained partners' staff started training the volunteers.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Completion of TOT on Orienting Local Activity Leaders. (training conducted)
1230-Conflict-affected women and girls 15+ and their families access quality psychosocial and reintegration activities.

description.narrative: the PSS activities focus on increasing women's knowledge and understanding about their rights, the PSS activities in 2020 were about teaching women and girls how to advocate for their rights and needs and empower these women to be able to continue advocacy even after the PSS activities finish.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
% of outreached women and girls, 15+ attending psychosocial and reintegration activities

description.narrative: apart from the CM services, PSS (recreational, fun, therapeutic, outdoor activities, life skills) partners are providing to support the vulnerable women and girls, particularly the case management clients, by helping them overcome their traumatic or problematic experiences. Due to Corona Virus curfew in targeted areas the outreach physical activities were kept on hold and online activities were conducted.

title.narrative: % of women and girls 15+ who regularly (more than 3 times) participated in a recreational, life skill activity.
1234.2-Agricultural Training hold for SGBV survivors

description.narrative: this project idea was proposed by PDO to support Yazidi women in Khanke area to start their own agricultural cooperative, 16 women were trained by agricultural expert, the training covered many topics such as (how to choose plants suitable for the environment, how to plant, harvest, watering systems and selling products).

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors attended Agricultural training sessions
1200-conflict-affected women and girls 15+ who are survivors of SGBV receive quality case management services, reintegration support and protection for life-threatening cases of SGBV.
2020 NPA baseline assessment report

% clients who rank their overall satisfaction with the quality of SGBV case management services as 4 or 5 out of 5. (confidential, respectful, supportive, helpful advice, referral access, timely follow-up).

description.narrative: Case Management services are interpreted here as comprehensive services, provided as needed through individual, private sessions to vulnerable women and girls 15+ who were identified as SGBV survivors. Although many women and girls still do not report the violence they experience due to various reasons but the ones who are reporting the incident receive comprehensive services that start from them giving their informed consent till case closure keeping in mind the survivor centered approach.

title.narrative: 1100- Strengthened civil society organizations are actively coordinating, protecting and promoting the rights and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls 15+.
Baseline report
Number of women’s rights advocacy initiatives, led by conflict-affected women and girls, implemented by 3 partners in line with their joint Advocacy strategy.

description.narrative: The focus of the project is grass root advocacy which is instead of NGOs staff leading and conducting advocacies women and girls from the community will do that and the NGOs staff will support them whenever needed, partners are currently working to develop plans for grass root advocacy and to approach communities.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners who receive ‘sufficient’ scores in a quarterly Community Centre report card, after year 2 of the programme

description.narrative: To receive a sufficient score card the partners are expected to build active coordination mechanism and have plans on place to promote the rights of women and girls.

title.narrative: 1110-CSO partners have improved organizational capacity (e.g. project, human resources, procurement and financial
2020 NPA Baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners that have demonstrated improved HR and planning capacity, ranking ‘satisfactory ‘in a capacity assessment report card.

description.narrative: Scoring is done focusing in partners HR and procurement systems and the improvements they achieved.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners that have demonstrated improved financial management capacity, ranking ‘satisfactory’ in a capacity assessment report card.

description.narrative: Scoring is done focusing in partners financial system and the improvements they achieved.

title.narrative: 1300- Conflict-affected women and girls 15+ are better able to understand and access their rights to participate: psychosocial, recreational, economic empowerment, educational, family and community decision-making processes.
2020 NPA Baseline report
% women and girls 15+ report that they would feel confident speaking up in family and community meetings/dialogue.

description.narrative: NPA and partners noticed that women are still suffering from suppression to express their feelings and thoughts in family and community dialogues, they feel either their opinions will be belittled or they will be yelled at by their male family members, since the beginning of NPA's work in protection the scope of NPA's work was to give women enough confidence to Speak up and have enough self-confidence to represent themselves and to accept themselves. while some of our beneficiaries during 2020 have improved their self-esteem to speak-up and demand their rights, we are still working on helping more women to have confidence and skills to promote and advocate for their rights.

title.narrative: 1130-CSO partners advocate more effectively for women's rights based on their own strategy for promoting women’s rights.
2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners that have Women's Rights Advocacy Action plans.

description.narrative: NPA had meetings with the three CSO partners to discuss about grass root advocacy and masculinity program and now the partners are working on preparing and developing their plans. Due to Coronavirus outbreak the activities were postponed.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partner that have at least 4 staff members/volunteer activity leaders trained to deliver awareness-raising sessions on women's rights.

description.narrative: The CSO partners have staff and volunteers trained to deliver sessions on women’s rights and psychosocial support for women, girls, men and boys.

title.narrative: 1120- CSO partners have improved capacity to deliver quality SGBV case management to conflict-affected women girls, and quality awareness sessions, PSS to women, men, girls and boys 15+.
2020 NPA Baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners offering gender-transformative recreational activities (energizing and relaxing) for women and girls 15+, on a weekly basis, in their operational areas.

description.narrative: The partners conduct psychosocial supporting sessions to male and female beneficiaries on weekly basis. However due to Corona virus outbreak the activities were stopped for a while then resumed online during the lockdown. currently the activities are provided face to face inside the community centers or in coordinated places for the participants that live in camps or in areas away from centers.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners who have at least 3 staff/volunteers who can lead life skill sessions for adolescent girls.

description.narrative: The partners’ staff are trained on facilitating sessions for beneficiaries including adolescent girls.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners who have 2 staff members available to provide orientation training to new local activity leaders.

description.narrative: Two of the partners have enough staff members to provide orientation and the new partner on the project (BWA) staff are being trained and given guidance to lead orientation sessions.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners with confidential case management documentation systems ranking ‘good’.

description.narrative: The partners are following the standardized GBV information management system of Iraq which includes instructions on preserving the confidentiality of the documentation. They all have received sufficient trainings and have locked cabinets and confidential digital filing.

title.narrative: 1210- Conflict-affected women and girls 15+ are accessing confidential and quality case management and referral to services (i.e., medical, legal, education, livelihoods etc.).
2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Percentage of cases receiving referrals that have received a follow up call within one week after referral.
Number of women and girls 15+ to receive case management services

description.narrative: during 2020 the face to face case management shifted to online and by phone case management, even though this was challenging for the survivors and for the social workers but it allowed us to make sure the S/GBV survivors condition will not worsen instead we will have the ability to assist them. this continuation of the case management built a trust relationship between CSOs and survivors because the survivors felt they have not been left out and we still care for them. after the lockdown came to an end the face to face case management resumed.

title.narrative: Percentage of cases receiving referrals to specialized services (medical, child protection, legal, education, livelihood etc).

description.narrative: Case management provides the beneficiaries with referral services and help them connect with external medical, legal and other relevant public services. Project efforts focus on providing wrap-around case management services for women and girls, including SGBV survivors, to address some of the most commonly needed services, as PSS including life skills and recreational activities, emotional aid and trauma counselling, coverage of medical costs, referral/escorts for medical care, legal services, and socio-economic programming.

title.narrative: Number of women and girls receiving simple needs services

description.narrative: simple needs services are specifically important for the process of the case management especially in 2020 where the needs of women were reflection of their mental health, women who couldn't access food or hygiene or any other needs were suffering more and having this line in the project's budget allowed us to help the women in need as well us build the trust between the survivors and the social workers.

title.narrative: 1320- Conflict-affected women and girls 15+ demonstrate improved rights awareness, life skills and confidence.
2020 NPA baseline assessment report

% of female participants active in over 6 life skills sessions and 6 recreational activities report improved confidence in family dialogue, decision making, voicing their opinion in the family and community.

description.narrative: NPA and partners noticed the increase of interest of women and girls to participate in life skills sessions (psychosocial sessions). Women and girls were wanting to boost their self-esteem and be powerful enough to have dialogue with their families and communities about their rights, their capabilities and their readiness to change their communities for the better.

title.narrative: % of awareness raising female participants report having basic knowledge of women’s rights, harmful social norms and SGBV

description.narrative: The activities especially (Psychosocial support and General Awareness Raising Sessions) are aimed to familiarize women with their rights and promote women’s rights and equality as well as build self-confidence and self-esteem of women

title.narrative: 1220- Conflict-affected women and girls 15+ are accessing confidential, alternative safe placements for the accommodation of SGBV survivors under threat.
2020 NPA baseline assessment report
% of women and girls 15+ who disclose life-threat receive confidential, alternative safe placements for a period of 1-10 months.
1132- Awareness-raising sessions guidelines are developed on topics relating to gender social norm change for CSOs partners working in 4 operational areas
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Awareness Raising Session Guidelines for gender social norm change

description.narrative: After many discussions and keeping in mind the current social situations and women rights violations that are happening in Iraq and lack of women role in promoting their rights. NPA with partners decided for this project the focus will be providing awareness raising sessions on grass roots advocacy and masculinity program.

title.narrative: 1114- Continuous training and coaching on MEAL and reporting is provided to 3 partner CSO
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on PMEAL and reporting.

description.narrative: During the reporting period MEAL team supported and provided guidance to the three CSO partners on using tools and reporting templates.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners to receive training on MEAL

description.narrative: The CSO partners received training on reporting and MEAL, the training focused in using standardized reporting method of the three of them and how to use MEAL tools.

title.narrative: 1113- Human resources training and ongoing recruitment support is provided to 3 CSO partners.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of partners to receive Human Resources training.
Number of CSOs Recruitment Days co-facilitated by NPA.

1232- Recreational and life skills activities are held for women and girls 15+, and recreational activities are held for their male family members and other males 15+ who reside in 4 operational areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of women and girls receiving vocational training

description.narrative: Vocational trainings are highly requested activities by beneficiaries as they find them opportunity to learn a new skill which might help them build a livelihood or find a job or at least use this skill to make their life easier.

title.narrative: Number of women and girls 15+ participating in recreational & life skills activities

description.narrative: PSS sessions are a key supportive component of the Case Management action planning aspect and are intended to provide psychosocial relief and recreational opportunities particularly for the SGBV survivors in order to strengthen their psychosocial well-being through recreation and learning life skills. They are also used as a platform for gaining access to the vulnerable women and girls in the targeted areas and accessing SGBV survivors and victims in a safe and comfortable environment where the participants could be motivated to talk about personal experiences. The activity also supports identifying potential SGBV cases in the communities, in addition to develop support social networks between women/girls themselves who critically lack meeting spaces where they could talk and spend time together. Recreational activities are provided for men, youth and children. This activity was used to generate community acceptance and support for the project services avoiding stigmatization of the places and services women.

title.narrative: Average number of men and boys 15+ participating in recreational activities each month

description.narrative: Same as women, PSS activities are provided to men as well, with more focus positive and negative masculinity and how the negative one impacts the suppression of women's rights and limits men's freedom of becoming themselves. The activities were on going but they were following the instructions from ministry of health to not have gatherings of more than six to eight people.

title.narrative: 1221- Safe alternative accommodation (max 10 months) and rehabilitation services are provided to SGBV survivors unable to return to family and/or facing physical threats in the 4 operational areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of clients who disclose a life-threat or who are unable to return to families to receive safe alternative accommodation.

description.narrative: There is only one safe shelter in Duhok, which is neglected and overcrowded. The shelter is lacking in many ways. Even though the shelter is owned by government but due to ongoing economic crisis the shelter is not receiving enough budget and is dependent on assistance from NGOs. In Mosul there is still no safe shelter to women subjected to violence even though NGOs are constantly advocating for that but still no actions were taken.

title.narrative: 1112-continuous training and coaching on financial management is provided for project managers and finance staff from 3 CSO partners.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors
Number of partners to receive training on financial management.

description.narrative: since Baghdad Women Association (BWA) is the new partner of the project, all the focus is to build their capacity including giving them financial trainings. During the reporting period all coaching activities were through online sessions and meetings.

title.narrative: Number of individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on financial management.

description.narrative: NPA finance team visited BWA centre in Mosul and spent an entire working day with them to support them and help them understand financial documents and procedures. apart form that NPA's finance team continue to provide coaching and guiding to partner's finance teams.

title.narrative: 1310- Conflict-affected women, girls, men and boys 15+ demonstrate more gender-equitable attitudes
NPA baseline assessment report
% of women, men, girls and boys 15+ who demonstrate an improved Gender Equality Indicator score.

description.narrative: NPA and partners noticed many positive changes in the attitudes of communities towards women rights; we noticed an increase of women and girls working outside their houses, we also witnessed more women driving cars in Mosul and act that was considered taboo for women only few years ago. men also became more accepting on women's rights, however some other forms of GBV has also increased such as early marriage and domestic violence where more than 50% of receiving cases during 2020 were cases of domestic violence.

title.narrative: 1131- Partner CSOs hold coordination meetings and present their joint advocacy agenda & plan for advancement of women's rights as per their own mandate.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Women’s rights advocacy planning partner meetings/workshops

description.narrative: NPA had meetings with the three partners to discuss about grass root advocacy and put a plan on how to implement the advocacy in targeted areas.

title.narrative: 1 year Joint partner Advocacy Strategy and Monitoring Framework
1121- Intensive & ongoing training & coaching on GBV Core Concepts, Safety Audits, Outreach, Case Management, PSS, Life-Skills & Self-Care etc. is provided to 3 CSOs operational in 4 areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of individualized coaching sessions on outreach and case management for CSO partners

description.narrative: During the reporting period coaching and mentoring was specifically provided to BWA (the new partner in the project) to make sure they provide effective case management services.

title.narrative: Number of core trainings delivered to Mobile Teams

description.narrative: Trainings on GBV Concept, Safety Audit, GBVIMS, Psychosocial support for S/GBV survivors and Case Management were delivered to CSO partners and then follow up was made to make sure partners are implementing what they have learnt.

title.narrative: 1133- Training on Delivering Awareness Raising Sessions is provided to CSO partners in 4 operational areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of CSO partner staff /volunteer activity leaders to complete the Awareness Raising training.
1122- Women's Community Centres and satellite safe spaces that have been established for confidential counselling and indoor recreation, and continue to operate in 4 areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Women’s Community Centres that are fully furnished, equipped, staffed and operational by the third Quarter of the programme.

description.narrative: Each partner has one center in one of their coverage areas. Emma had a community center in Duhok city covering the areas of (Duhok non-camp, Shariya non-camp, Dawdiya Camp, Darkar camp, Qadiya Camp Akra non-camp and Bardarash non-camp), PDO has an operating community center in Khanke district covering the areas of (Khanke camp and non-camps, Kabarto 1 and Kabarto 2 camps, Chammishko camp, Semel non-camp and Msirike non-camp) and BWA opened a center in Mosul city covering east side of Mosul.

title.narrative: Number of satellite safe spaces that are established and operational

description.narrative: the CSO partners had already four satellite safe spaces and through coordination and assessment they are already working to find other satellite safe spaces for their activities.

title.narrative: 1231- Orientation Training on Code of Conduct, GBV Core Concepts, Effective PSS Sessions and Trauma Sensitivity is held for local activity leaders (e.g. volunteers, skilled facilitators) from 4 operational areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Local Activity Leaders to complete Orientation Training
1111- Continuous training and coaching on project planning and management is provided for 3 CSO.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of training and individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on project management.

description.narrative: In the beginning of December 2019, an inception workshop was conducted by NPA for three CSO partners to explain about goals and plans of the new project and what are aspects that need to be focused on. Another orientation workshop was conducted for the new partner of the project (BWA) on NPAs roles and regulations, partnerships system, financial systems, compliance and code of conduct.

title.narrative: Number of partners to receive training on project management
